official-title.#text:
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to repeal the windfall elimination provision and
			 protect the retirement of public servants.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Equal Treatment of Public Servants Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Equal Treatment of Public Servants Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Replacement of the windfall elimination provision with a formula equalizing benefits for certain
			 individuals with non-covered employment

text.#text:
In the case of an individual whose primary insurance amount would be computed under paragraph (1)
			 of this subsection—

who becomes eligible for old-age insurance benefits after 2016 or would attain age 62 after 2016
			 and becomes eligible for disability insurance benefits after 2016,
who subsequently becomes entitled to such benefits, and
who has earnings derived from noncovered service performed in a year after 1977,

continuation-text.#text: rounded, if not a multiple of $0.10, to the next lower multiple of $0.10.

text.#text:
The primary insurance amount of an individual described in subparagraph (A), as computed or
			 recomputed under this paragraph, shall be the product derived by
			 multiplying—

the individual’s primary insurance amount, as determined under paragraph (1) of this subsection and
			 subparagraph (C) of this paragraph, by
a fraction—

the numerator of which is the individual’s average indexed monthly earnings (determined without
			 regard to subparagraph (C)), and

the denominator of which is an amount equal to the individual’s average indexed monthly earnings
			 (as determined under subparagraph (C)),

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

header.#text:
Modification of windfall elimination provision for current beneficiaries; recovery of certain
			 overpayments

text.#text:
Notwithstanding subparagraph (A), for purposes of determining the amount of monthly insurance
			 benefits for months after December 2016, the primary insurance amount of
			 an individual described in subparagraph (A), or an individual described in
			 subparagraph (G) whose primary insurance amount was calculated or
			 recalculated under subparagraph (B), shall be deemed to be equal to the
			 sum of—
the primary insurance amount of such individual computed or recomputed under subparagraph (B); plus

the applicable percentage (determined under clause (ii)) of the amount by which the primary
			 insurance amount of such individual computed or recomputed under
			 subparagraph (B) is exceeded by the primary insurance amount of such
			 individual that would be determined without regard to this paragraph.

text.#text:
In the case of an individual whose primary insurance amount would be computed under paragraph (1)
			 of this subsection who—

attains age 62 after 1985 and before 2017 (except where he or she became entitled to a disability
			 insurance benefit before 1986 and remained so entitled in any of the 12
			 months immediately preceding his or her attainment of age 62), or

would attain age 62 after 1985 and before 2017 and becomes eligible for a disability insurance
			 benefit after 1985 and before 2017, and
is eligible for old-age insurance benefits or disability insurance benefits for December 2016,
has recorded noncovered earnings (as defined in paragraph (8)(C)(ii)), and
has less than 30 years of coverage (as defined in subparagraph (D)),
